{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3535924,"name":"","username":"KaV1a","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kav1a/{size}/218881_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T00:22:47.482Z","cooked":"

Hello all,

While we were implementing PoseEstimator code using PhotonVision, we started having problems with memory. We’ve isolated the problem to being this line of code:

public static final AprilTagFieldLayout FIELD_LAYOUT = AprilTagFieldLayout.loadField(AprilTagFields.k2025ReefscapeWelded);

After a few minutes of the robot being idle, we got this error :

OpenJDK Client VM warning: INFO: os::commit_memory(0xb4289000, 32768, 1) failed; error=‘Not enough space’ (errno=12)

# There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue.

# Native memory allocation (mmap) failed to map 32768 bytes for committing reserved memory.

# An error report file with more information is saved as:

# /tmp/hs_err_pid2188.log

as well as:

terminate called after throwing an instance of ‘std::bad_alloc’

what(): std::bad_alloc

This line of code may not be the sole cause, because when trying that line on a blank commandrobot template, we had no crash issues. Is something in our code taking too much memory in the roboRIO that causes this fieldlayout variable to crash it? How can we fix this? Here’s our code repository. We can provide any information needed. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T00:27:44.797Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":104,"reads":219,"readers_count":218,"score":558.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492657,"topic_slug":"memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/FRC2495/FRC2495-2025","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - FRC2495/FRC2495-2025","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57483,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem/492657/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3535967,"name":"","username":"KfirNeuman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T01:18:09.113Z","cooked":"

Can you send the stack trace with the function calls so that we know which functions to look in?

If you’re using a Rio 1, you’ll probably need to do one or more of the workarounds on this page to free up some memory:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Java Garbage Collection

Java garbage collection is the process of automatically managing memory for Java objects. The Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is responsible for creating and destroying objects, and the garbage collecto...

I’d be interested in hearing from folks who’ve used USB swap. does it act as dead swap, or does it actually get used during robot code execution? that can’t be fast, can it?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T02:21:35.471Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492657,"topic_slug":"memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem/492657/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536034,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T02:30:25.545Z","cooked":"

The OS isn’t going to swap out actively used memory areas, so what will get swapped out is things like the webserver or other idle processes, not the robot program itself. The biggest thing it gives is room for overcommit (which the sysctl setting change helps with more easily).

is there any harm to overcommit? we have both 1.0 and 2.0, it would be nice for the config to be the same for both.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T02:51:06.916Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492657,"topic_slug":"memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem/492657/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536121,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T03:55:28.415Z","cooked":"

For our use case, no. It just means that if the memory allocated isn’t available at the time it’s actually used (first accessed), it crashes then, rather than crashing immediately when it’s allocated.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T03:55:28.415Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492657,"topic_slug":"memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem/492657/7","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536247,"name":"","username":"ntnx0246","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T11:34:11.161Z","cooked":"

We had a similar issue with this exact line and the problem was that we were creating an instance of our camera in periodic which caused a memory issue right after the deploy.
I would check to make sure this line of code is only being run once on initialize because the field image seems to take up a large amount of memory quickly and that new instances are not being created.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T11:34:11.161Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":38.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492657,"topic_slug":"memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem/492657/8","custom_user_title":"Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537183,"name":"5436 Cyber Cats Mentor","username":"bigCAT","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/9fc348/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T16:07:56.475Z","cooked":"

We experienced a similar issue yesterday while running Autonomous routines with PathPlanner. We are using WPILib 2025V3.1 with a RoboRio1.0

We instantiate a field map, but weren’t running any recurring method calls on it.

private AprilTagFieldLayout aprilTagFieldLayout = AprilTagFieldLayout.loadField(AprilTagFields.kDefaultField);

The error we see on the drive station is:

OpenJDK Client VM warning: INFO: os::commit_memory(0xb0420000, 2789376, 0) failed; error='Not enough space' (errno=12)
 # /tmp/hs_err_pid4901.log  # An error report file with more information is saved as:  # Native memory allocation (mmap) failed to map 2789376 bytes for committing reserved memory.  # There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue.  #

We plan on updating to RoboRio 2.0 to see if that resolves the issue. If that doesn’t fix it, we’ll look at implementing the Garbage Collection suggestions noted by Peter above.

What other info can I provide to help troubleshoot?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T16:08:59.689Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492657,"topic_slug":"memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem","display_username":"5436 Cyber Cats Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55517,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem/492657/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537248,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T17:04:49.598Z","cooked":"

There really aren’t any additional troubleshooting steps. Loading the apriltag layout takes a fair amount of memory because it’s deserializing a JSON and using a fairly expensive library to do that. So the fixes/workarounds are to free up memory or use a Rio 2.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T17:04:59.370Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":37.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492657,"topic_slug":"memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55517,"username":"bigCAT","name":"5436 Cyber Cats Mentor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/9fc348/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/memory-leak-robot-code-crash-problem/492657/10","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537614,"name":"","username":"KaV1a","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kav1a/{size}/218881_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T01:56:31.191Z","cooked":"

I’ll send that at our next meeting tomorrow
